lines.content: * The Duke program implements an application that
* acts as a task manager for users that allows users to write task into a file and
* update the file accordingly when users have completed their task/wish to delete a
* This storage deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* ui deals with interactions with the user.
* tasks contains the task list of users and operations like adding and removing tasks in the list.
* Class constructor of Duke that processes user input and outputs the tasks into a data file.
* If a data file is already created in the given file path, the data file is updated according to
* the user's input. If file does not exist in the given file path, a new date file is created.
* @param filePath The path of the file to be read and written.
* This method is used to allow the execution of duke to take place until the user exits
* the program. It allows the program to keep reading the user's input until the user exits the program.
* This is the main method where Duke is instantiated and executed using the run method.
* A default file path to /duke.txt is provided in the main method.
* Represents the Command to add new tasks into the task list.
* Represents the task to be added.
* Class constructor. Enables the addition of the task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added into the task list.
* This method allows for the execution of the add command which adds the stated task into the TaskList tasks
* @param tasks The task lists which contains all the user added tasks.
* @param ui The user interface which deals with user input and interaction.
* @param storage The storage to load and save task data into the output file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command is the abstract base class for all commands in Duke application
* which allows for the user to instruct what is to be done to the current task list.
* Determines whether the user intends to terminate Duke application in the
* Class constructor for a default command which does not terminate the Duke application.
* This method defines what the user wants to do in the Duke application, such as
* delete a task, mark a task as completed, or add a new task to the task list.
* @param tasks The task lists which contains all the user added tasks.
* @param ui The user interface which deals with user input and interaction.
* @param storage The storage to load and save task data into the output file.
* @throws DukeException If there is a problem with data processing, loading or saving.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* This method checks if the command is one that requires the closing of Duke
* @return true if the command calls for the termination of the application.

* This method when called results in the closing of all processes in the Duke
